state: You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal! -= Bedroom =- You find yourself in a bedroom. An ordinary one. You try to gain information on your surroundings by using a technique you call "looking." You can see a bed! However, the bed, like an empty bed, has nothing on it. There is an exit to the east. Don't worry, there is no door. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is not blocked by one. > -= Bedroom =-0/1

next_state: -= Livingroom =- You are in a livingroom. A normal kind of place. You decide to just list off a complete list of everything you see in the room, because hey, why not? You can see a sofa. The sofa is comfy. But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of junk. It would have been so cool if there was stuff on the sofa. There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, there is no door. You need an exit without a door? You should try going west. > -= Livingroom =-0/3

next_state: -= Kitchen =- Fancy seeing you here. Here, by the way, being the kitchen. You can see a fridge. The fridge contains a white onion, a raw white tuna, a yellow onion and a red onion. You smell a wretched smell, and follow it to an oven. You make out a table. The table is massive. Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though. You can see a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you see a roasted red potato, a raw red tuna, a raw purple potato, a cookbook and a knife. You make out a stove. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on. But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of trash. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it? There is an open frosted-glass door leading east. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, there is no door. You need an exit without a door? You should try going west. > -= Kitchen =-0/4
